title: How to Bake Tofu

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).
steps.description: Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil.

steps.headline: Drain all water from the tofu.
steps.description: Wrap the tofu in paper towels and allow it to set for about five minutes.

steps.headline: Make the soy sauce mixture.
steps.description: Combine soy sauce, garlic, ginger and vegetable oil in a small bowl.

steps.headline: Slice the tofu into 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) thick slices.
steps.description: Place the tofu slices on the baking sheet.

steps.headline: Drizzle the soy sauce mixture over the tofu.
steps.description: Use a spatula to gently turn the slices over to coat both sides with the sauce.

steps.headline: Bake the tofu for about 15 minutes.
steps.description: Turn the slices over and bake for another 15 minutes. The tofu should be light golden-brown and firm.

steps.headline: Serve the tofu hot.
steps.description: Use the tofu as a substitute for meat or mix it into fried rice or a stir-fry.

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil. Drain all water from the tofu. Wrap the tofu in paper towels and allow it to set for about five minutes. Make the soy sauce mixture. Combine soy sauce, garlic, ginger and vegetable oil in a small bowl. Slice the tofu into 1/2 inch (1.27 cm) thick slices. Place the tofu slices on the baking sheet. Drizzle the soy sauce mixture over the tofu. Use a spatula to gently turn the slices over to coat both sides with the sauce. Bake the tofu for about 15 minutes. Turn the slices over and bake for another 15 minutes. The tofu should be light golden-brown and firm. Serve the tofu hot. Use the tofu as a substitute for meat or mix it into fried rice or a stir-fry.
